reviews.review_msg: Great ProfTook both his ECON383 and ECON355w. Although there is a lot content in the lectures, you can get good grade if you listen carefully in his class and do enough practices. I like his teaching style, always teach us by using real life examples-show us the bank website to find things that correlated with concepts.
He is a really good prof. I like his teaching style, and it's easy to get a good grade.
polite and kind, hard-working on helping you
Good prof!
Amazing Lectures
I really like his teaching style!!!!! I would like to take his other course again!!!!

He is a really good prof who tried to help everyone in his class. If you get in trouble with the assignments or midterms(I hope not), then you should attend every tutorial to get extra bonus marks. If this is your last class, then you'd better let him know it, since he is very kind to his students. In short, he is a professional and helpful prof.
The course is quite straightforward as Emrul does not test much math, it is simply equations of some economic models other than that its just reading, you get it you do well.
Very passionate instructor and he works very hard to make sure students understand the concepts. Available outside class too.

Amazing prof and class!! After taking this class I realized that I wanted to specialize in economic development! I have never loved an econ this much before! There's a few writing assignments which are fair, and the midterm and final are fair.
Emurl teaches really well. I like his teaching style very much. The phenomenon in class is easygoing but we have never missed any important point.

Econ355w had so much take-home and in-class assignments. The work was heavy but the instructor's dedication towards academic honesty is amazing. He made some assignments in-class so that students cannot hire outside people to write the assignment for them. I liked it. 5 star for that :)

He is an awesome pro, always use his own examples to help us understand materials. Always finish class early and expect us to read. He gave the assignments not only for testing but also for helping us learning class. Definitely will take him again

His lectures were interesting as he tried to incorporate personal experiences to make the concepts more memorable (which did work). The assignments were relatively easy (600 words), but TH questions were TOUGH. Only had a final (45%) which was fair if you followed along with tutorial questions and assignment Qs.

I'm glad I got to take a class with Emrul. He's a good lecturer and adds a great amount of perspective to the base content of the class. The lectures can be a bit dry, but Emrul has a good sense of humour. He's very clear on what you should study, he drops hints every week as for what could end up on the final.

Thank you Emrul. One of the most influential lecturers I've ever had, thanks to him my political and economic views are more eclectic. I thoroughly enjoyed the class with him and I hope he continues to teach.

He replies emails really fast and very efficient at solving problem. He is hilarious and nice. His exam is fair if you do all the work by yourself (don't cheat) and attend lectures and tutorials. If you feel like you are failing the course, just try your best on exam and you will always be surprised by the mark you receive.

This class is not hard, just tried to finish all assignments by urself and reading lectures. This prof is Fair, and he really hates cheating, but he's nice and still give some cheating students marks... i think final exam is esay if u work by urself...

Professor Emrul had a defined structure for the course, was clear about expectations and readings, and his comments/suggestions for those who attended the lectures was really helpful for midterm and finals preparation. His grading criteria for the short papers were concise and helps to learn outside the textbook via research. Good professor!

I really enjoyed this class it was my nest mark in university. This teacher was very helpful and very passionate about his work. He was very fair and I learned a lot. I would definitely take this class again.
What a prof!!! So amazed!! Love him :)
the best prof I have ever had, really good man
As long as you read stuff on text book, and write notes during lectures, you will get what you deserve.
good professor , nobody can fail
He is a excellent prof. the lecture was really useful and just attend his lecture and tutorial, you will be more than fine.
